This work is taking place along Shortgate Lane.

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: We regularly inspect our electrical equipment to ensure it is safe and efficient. We need to examine a transformer on our electricity poles to check it is functioning properly. This essential work helps to provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, reducing the risk of any unplanned power cuts in the future as we appreciate your area has been impacted with unplanned power cuts in the last 6 months. To keep everyone safe while we carry out these works, we will need to temporarily turn off your electricity. We are taking extra measures to limit the time your power is off and we'll do our best to cause as little disruption as possible. Doing this will improve the reliability of the electricity network in the future. This work is taking place on Halesworth Road.

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: To provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, we carry out regular inspections of our equipment in your area. This has identified an electricity pole that needs replacing and upgrading. Tree trimming around our overhead cables will also be carried out by some of our contractors. Doing this will reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut in the future as we appreciate some customers may have experienced unplanned power cuts in the last 6 months. To complete the work safely, we need to turn your power off to upgrade the pole. To ensure the power is off for the shortest possible time, our contractors will be in the area carrying out preparation works and delivering equipment from the 9th of February 2026. Please can customers who have solar panels isolate these to try avoid potential generator issues. This work is taking place near Clapton Hall Lane.

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: We regularly inspect our electrical equipment to ensure it is safe and efficient. We need to examine a transformer on our electricity poles to check it is functioning properly. This essential work helps to provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, reducing the risk of any unplanned power cuts in the future as we appreciate your area has been impacted with unplanned power cuts in the last 6 months. To keep everyone safe while we carry out these works, we will need to temporarily turn off your electricity. We are taking extra measures to limit the time your power is off and we'll do our best to cause as little disruption as possible. Doing this will improve the reliability of the electricity network in the future. This work is taking place on Land near Doddington Road.

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: We are needing to replace a piece of our electrical equipment due to it coming to the end of its serviceable life. This equipment is known as a linkbox and is essential equipment where our cables connect underground. To ensure our engineers can carry out these works safely we will need to temporarily switch off your power. Once work is completed this will ensure our electricity network is working to the best of its ability and also reduce the possibility of having an unplanned power cut as we appreciate your area has been impacted with unplanned power cuts in the last 6 months. This work is taking place in the Marlborough Road area.

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: To provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, we carry out regular inspections of our equipment in your area. This has identified a span of overhead cable and an electricity pole that need replacing and upgrading for safety reasons. Doing this improve the reliability of the network and will reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut in the future. To complete the work safely, we need to turn your power off to replace and upgrade the equipment. To ensure the power is off for the shortest possible time, our contractors may carry out preparation works prior to the power cut. This work is taking place in the Rhoon Road area.

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: BT has asked UK Power Networks to switch off the power so they can safely replace and upgrade a shared pole which is decaying. To ensure the works can be carried out safely we will need to temporarily switch off your power. Doing this will improve the reliability of the network and reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut in the future as we appreciate some customers may have experienced unplanned power cuts in the last 6 months. This work is taking place on Chinnor Road.

Steps.Message:
Sent by David at 21:20 - Hi David here again. Thank you for your patience while our engineers continue their investigations on the underground network in the CR5 4 and SM7 3 area. We have now restored power to all but one property. We're sorry for any disruption this unexpected power cut caused.

If your power isn't back on, we'd still like to keep you updated. If we aren't currently in contact with you by phone or in person at your property, please call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by David at 21:14 - We're sorry for the disruption to your power today, especially for those who may be more vulnerable without the electric. If you're worried about an elderly or ill person in your property who is affected by the power cut today, we are able to provide some support. For more information just click here: https://UKPN.short.gy/PSR If you have any further concerns or questions though, don't hesitate to call us free on 08003163105. We'll continue to keep you updated with our engineer's progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by David at 21:08 - I appreciate your continued patience during the power cut today. Our staff are working as quickly as they can to get the lights back on, and they've advised us that there are now 185 properties still affected. They have managed to get a further 254 of our customers back on by diverting electricity, so your power may have come on sooner than we originally advised. If you're still off, please don't worry; work on the issue will continue along with SMS updates until everyone is back on. To stop receiving texts, just follow this link https://bit.ly/348KOZ3 to unsubscribe.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Bev at 22:41 - I'm pleased to confirm that all power in the West Hendon Broadway area should be back on. The issue was caused by an unexpected third party damage to our underground cabling, which our engineers have now repaired.

We know that a power cut can be difficult, and I'm sorry for the length of the time you were without your electricity. Please rest assured that our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Hi, this is Bev - I wanted to let you know I have just taken over for the night shift, so I'll be here until tomorrow morning making sure you have the latest news from our staff.

I know that power being off may be especially worrying for you as we head later into the evening, but our field teams work 24 hours so I'll let know further news as soon as it comes in.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
We have further teams of engineers on their way to help restore power in the West Hendon Broadway area. Based on what we know about the issue so far, and to allow them time to arrive and make repairs, we've changed the estimated time to between 01:00 and 02:00.

We're sorry for the delay, but we'll let you know when they arrive and we'll keep you updated with progress. If you have any questions or concerns, our team are always here to help on 105. Sent by Simon at 21:42.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Theo at 01:18 - Thanks for your patience today, we're happy to say our staff have now restored power to all but one property in the Thorn Road TN12 area. I'm sorry for any disruption we caused by having to turn off your power to repair a damaged piece of network equipment.

We'd still like to keep you informed if your electricity hasn't been restored. Please call us free any time on 08003163105 if we haven't already reached out to you by phone or in person at your property.

We apologise for the outage and understand that being without power can be challenging. Rest assured that our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep your lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Theo at 01:05 - We want to reassure you that we've certainly not forgotten about you and we know that the estimated time frame has now passed. Getting you an update is our priority, as we know it's important that you have the latest information.

Our team on site are still working, and we are liaising with them to get a progress update to you as soon as we can safely do so. As soon as we hear from them we'll be in touch, or you can call us on 105 if you need any additional support.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Theo at 00:04 - We're sorry for the disruption to your power today, especially for those who may be more vulnerable without the electric. We'll continue to keep you updated with our engineer's progress.

Sent by Theo at 22:15 - Thanks for bearing with us, we know being without power can be frustrating. I'll be on hand to update you as our staff work on repairs, and I just wanted to give you the latest from site.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Theo at 03:48 - We can now confirm that all power in the Maldon Road area should be back on.

Our staff are trying to find the root cause and fix it permanently, however with this kind of issue it's likely that power will go off multiple times before we're able to find and fix it. For now we have restored your power as quickly as we can.

If your power isn't on or you would like to talk to us, call us for free on 08003163105. We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
I appreciate your continued patience this morning. I know having power cuts as often as this must be very disruptive, and our staff are doing everything they can to get this resolved.

They are still testing our network in the area, and depending on the local infrastructure this can take some time. However, once they update us we'll know if our estimated time frame needs to change and why, and I'll let you know as soon as we hear.

In the meantime, if we can offer any support or advice, our team are always available to talk on 105.

Sent by Theo at 03:10.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our staff have now arrived on site in the Maldon Road area. They will start running tests at our substation to see how the local network is operating.

It's quite common for power to be restored briefly and go off again; this is our engineers using testing equipment to energise different sections of our network - this helps to narrow down any possible issues.

Our cabling network is often broken down by smaller sites, and our staff may also check these to test for any problems, and they may also walk the cabling route to see if there are any signs of malfunction that have appeared on the surface. Our time frame hasn't been adjusted, so for now I'll let you know more news as soon as our staff update us.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Will at 10:59 - I'm pleased to confirm that all power in the Clarence Avenue area should be back on. The issue was caused by an unexpected underground cable fault, which our engineers have now been able to isolate from the main network, which has allowed them to restore power.

We know that a power cut can be difficult, and I'm sorry for the length of the time you were without your electricity. Please rest assured that our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Will at 10:27 - We're sorry for the disruption to your power today, especially for those who may be more vulnerable without the electric. If you're worried about an elderly or ill person in your property who is affected by the power cut today, we are able to provide some support. For more information just click here: https://UKPN.short.gy/PSR If you have any further concerns or questions though, don't hesitate to call us free on 08003163105. We'll continue to keep you updated with our engineer's progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Will at 09:08 - Thanks for bearing with us over today. Our team of cable jointers have now identified the suspected section of faulted underground cabling using their specialist equipment.

Our digging team are now removing further ground to expose the cable for repairs, and this can take some time depending on the surface material, and how much space is needed to allow our engineers to assess the fault and make their repairs safely. 

Our estimated time frame of 11:30 and 12:30 doesn't need to change currently. We'll continue to keep you updated, but our team are always here if you have any questions.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Adam at 13:18 - We are sorry to have to let you know that it's going to take us a little longer than we expected to get all the power back on in the area. Our engineers advise that due to the amount of excavations required, additional time is needed to complete these.

Therefore, we're now aiming to restore supplies between 15:30 and 16:30. We're sorry we've had to change the estimated time, but we'll keep you updated.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Adam at 12:29 - Our engineers have advised us that in order to continue their works on the underground network fault safely, they have had to turn off power to further properties in the area. Our estimated time of 14:30-15:30 hasn't changed. If you'd like more information about why we sometimes have to switch power off to work; here's a short video https://UKPN.short.gy/Isol. We'll keep you updated with progress.

Steps.Message: Sent by Adam at 13:17 - Hi - thanks for bearing with us, I know a power cut can be very disruptive. We've had an update from our staff that there are now 28 properties still affected by the overhead network fault, as they have managed to safely divert some power, getting the lights back on for 21 of our customers. We'll keep sending text updates to everyone until all the power to your area is on. To stop receiving texts, just follow this link https://UKPN.short.gy/STOP to unsubscribe.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Hello, Adam from the messaging team here. Thanks for your patience today, our field staff and control room engineers are working to get your power back on as quickly as they can.

Our records show that some properties affected by today's power cut may have had other unexpected interruptions recently. If you have, we're sorry for further disruption. All power cuts are fully investigated by our engineers but can sometimes happen multiple times before we can safely find the issue and fix it.

We know that not everyone affected by today's power cut will have had other power cuts recently, but we want you to know that if you have, our customer services team will try to update as many customers as possible about our investigations.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Adam at 12:00 - We're sorry for the disruption to your power today, especially for those who may be more vulnerable without the electric. If you're worried about an elderly or ill person in your property who is affected by the power cut today, we are able to provide some support. For more information just click here: https://UKPN.short.gy/PSR If you have any further concerns or questions though, don't hesitate to call us free on 08003163105. We'll continue to keep you updated with our engineer's progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

We’ll continue to update you until everyone’s power is back on.

MainMessage: We are aware of an incident caused by 11kV OH Fault affecting the electricity supply in your area. Our engineers are dealing with this and we estimate that most supplies will be restored by 18-FEB-2026 16:00.  Please accept our sincere apologies for any inconvenience this may cause.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Adam at 10:52 - We can now confirm that all power in the Clarence Road area should be back on.

Our staff are trying to find the root cause and fix it permanently, however with this kind of issue it's likely that power will go off multiple times before we're able to find and fix it. For now we have restored your power as quickly as we can.

If your power isn't on or you would like to talk to us, call us for free on 08003163105. We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our staff have now arrived on site in the Clarence Road area. They will start running tests at our substation to see how the local network is operating.

It's quite common for power to be restored briefly and go off again; this is our engineers using testing equipment to energise different sections of our network - this helps to narrow down any possible issues.

Our cabling network is often broken down by smaller sites, and our staff may also check these to test for any problems, and they may also walk the cabling route to see if there are any signs of malfunction that have appeared on the surface. Our time frame hasn't been adjusted, so for now I'll let you know more news as soon as our staff update us.

Steps.Message: Hi, I'm Ebony and I'm the manager of the text messaging team at UK Power Networks. Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Talie at 12:49 - Our engineers have now restored power to all 853 customers in the Betchworth, RH3 7 area, by diverting power around the tree which was in contact with our overhead cabling. We know a power cut can be difficult; we're sorry for any disruption this unplanned power cut caused.  

We know some properties in the area may have faced other recent interruptions, and we're sorry for the extra disruption. Every outage is fully investigated by our engineers, though power may be lost several times before we can safely find and fix the issue. Our customer services team will keep as many customers updated as possible during these investigations.

To talk to us, or let us know that your power isn't restored, call us on 08003163105.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Talie at 12:15 - Thanks for your patience over today.

Further teams of engineers have now arrived to assist in the removal of the tree from our overhead cabling. To give them time to do this safely, the estimated time frame to restore your power is now between 13:30 and 14:30.

We're sorry this is taking longer than expected, and we'll continue to keep you up to date, but if any change to this time comes in from our staff I'll let you know as soon as we hear.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:

PlannedIncidentReason: To provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, we carry out regular inspections of our equipment in your area. This has identified 4 spans cables and 5 poles that need replacing and upgrading. Doing this will reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut in the future as we appreciate your area has been impacted with unplanned power cuts in the last 6 months. To complete the work safely, we need to turn your power off to upgrade the equipment. To ensure the power is off for the shortest possible time, our contractors Avidety may carry out preparation works prior to the power cut. Avidety will need access to the inside of your property to conduct safety checks in the morning before we switch off the power and we will need to do another check when we turn the power back on. This work is taking place in Poulton Lane in Canterbury.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Adam at 12:54 - We can now confirm that all power in the Turnpike End area should be back on. The issue was caused by an unexpected fault with some of our network equipment, which our engineers have now replaced.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Adam at 12:40 - Thanks for bearing with us today.

Our engineers are checking our substation equipment to ensure our network is healthy before they attempt to restore your power. They may also walk our cabling route throughout the area to check for any visible problems, check smaller electrical sites in the area, or apply specialist equipment which may restore power temporarily to help them with their testing.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them.

We'll keep you updated on our engineers progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Our engineers have arrived on site in the Turnpike End area, the estimated time of 15:30-16:30 hasn't changed. We know that a power cut can be very disruptive; we understand this can greatly impact your daily activities and we want to support you however we can. We'll update you with all of our progress, but if you need to speak to us, call our team on 08003163105 any time. If you would like more information about what we think the fault is; here's a short YouTube video https://UKPN.short.gy/fuse. Sent by Adam at 12:33.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Adam at 12:18 - Engineers are on their way. At this point we think the issue is a fault with equipment in your local substation in the Turnpike End area. We didn't know this was going to happen, so time frames we provide throughout are estimated and are subject to change.

Our estimated time to have power back on is currently between 15:30 and 16:30, but after we arrive and assess the situation this may change. The reason for this is there can sometimes be a more complex underlying issue found by our engineer's tests which may take longer, and if not we may get power back on sooner.

All of our texts are written and sent personally by our team, and we'll let you know once our staff arrive.

Steps.Message: We have engineers on their way. As this is affecting your area, they will not need to attend your property. Rest assured once they arrive, they’ll work as quickly as is safely possible to get your power back on.
Steps.Name: Engineers on their way

Steps.Message: Engineers are now on site, carrying out investigations into the fault. Once they have completed their assessment, they will carry out repairs.
Steps.Name: Investigating & fixing

Steps.Message: All power in the area should be back on. We’re really sorry for any disruption this caused.
Steps.Name: Power back on
